title: I bought the full version of Hocus Pocus....
content:
So I did fanart to celebrate! ^_^

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v139/RocketJess/hocus.jpg[/img]

(I might do Popopa soon. ^_^)

Also, I've been wondering... quite often I'll randomly get rapid-fire or sometimes laser blasts (and once both keys!) without picking up the potions. I'm wondering if this is some sort of glitch or if it's actually meant to happen. Although I legally own the full version, the one I'm playing is actually a mix of the full-version hocus.exe and hocus.dat with the rest of it being the shareware program, because the shareware version worked on my computer but the full version didn't. So could it be some odd side-effect of combining the two versions?[hr]

RocketJess, blasting off again!

[url=http://www.geocities.com/rocketjess]The Dragonkeeper's Lair[/url]

title: Re: I bought the full version of Hocus Pocus....
content:
That artwork is quite excellent, as always.

Getting keys and rapid fire seem a little too (for lack of a better word) 'specific' a problem of combining shareware and full version. However, there are cheats which enable all the things you've listed. Perhaps it is the mixture of both versions causing something with the cheats to activate randomly.

I haven't played Hocus Pocus for some time (didn't find it much fun) but I don't recall that sort of thing ever happening on purpose. It's interesting that one version of the game works and another doesn't. What sort of error did you get for the full version?[url=http://txv.shortcutman.net/pccw/][img]http://txv.shortcutman.net/pccw/imgs/links/pccwsml.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: I bought the full version of Hocus Pocus....
content: Nice picture, although I haven't played this game. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

title: Re: I bought the full version of Hocus Pocus....
content:
What sort of error did you get for the full version?

When I run the working version, it first brings up a "DOS" window with some writing and "Press a key", then the game runs full-screen after that. But the full version just briefly has the DOS window with no writing, then it vanishes after a second and nothing at all happens after that. I'm running in with Windows XP and I don't have DOSbox. (Most of my other games work, but a couple of other ones have the same problem.)[hr]

RocketJess, blasting off again!

[url=http://www.geocities.com/rocketjess]The Dragonkeeper's Lair[/url]

title: Re: I bought the full version of Hocus Pocus....
Re: I bought the full version of Hocus Pocus....
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]RocketJess: But the full version just briefly has the DOS window with no writing, then it vanishes after a second and nothing at all happens after that.[hr][/quote]

That sounds a lot like the characteristics of a runtime error. I know Jazz Jackrabbit will do the same thing running under Windows on faster computers. Perhaps you should consider DOSbox - it'll probably work there. I wonder why it's only the full version that does it...

Did you buy the game directly from 3D Realms?[url=http://txv.shortcutman.net/pccw/][img]http://txv.shortcutman.net/pccw/imgs/links/pccwsml.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: I bought the full version of Hocus Pocus....
content:
Yes, I bought it from 3D Realms.

And Jazz Jackrabbit *does* have the same problem. ^_^; So does Highway Hunter. I think those are the only ones I've had trouble with, though.[hr]

RocketJess, blasting off again!

[url=http://www.geocities.com/rocketjess]The Dragonkeeper's Lair[/url]

title: re: Hocus topic!
content:
Heh, looks nice. Not exactly an accurate portrayal based on the ingame pictures, but an interesting restyling.
And yeah, Hocus tends to give you the cheat codes at random intervals. Well, most of them.. I don't think feelgood happens that way.

title: Re: re: Hocus topic!
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]For some strange reason your pic reminds me of link.[hr][/quote]

I couldn't agree more. I knew that pic reminded me of SOMETHING, but I couldn't put my finger on it. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img] -- Shame on you if you fool me once, shame on me if you fool me twice --

title: Re: re: Hocus topic!
content:
Yes, I know he looks like Link. It's not intentional. ^_^;;; It just came out that way. I think it's the ears and the hat. And he's blonde, but that was because I was basing it partly off the [url=http://www.mobygames.com/game/dos/hocus-pocus/cover-art/gameCoverId,25820]cover art[/url] (which is also where I got the belt design from). As well as Link he also looks rather like [img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v139/RocketJess/art11.jpg[/img] and [img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v139/RocketJess/mayav14.jpg[/img], which I blame on my current obsessions with both those characters... ^_^;
Mostly he's based off the in-game sprite rather than the story screens - for which he has a completely different outfit! I have no idea why they did that... >_<[hr]

RocketJess, blasting off again!

[url=http://www.geocities.com/rocketjess]The Dragonkeeper's Lair[/url]

title: Re: re: Hocus topic!
content:
Hocus did not have the most consistent art, part of which is probably because they didn't have the storyline or character design installed until a while into development. I mean, look at the instruction screen - Terexin is called Wizard, and the outfit used by his sprite is significantly less fancy than that used by the big pictures.
(The cover art looks more like someone was given the beta sprite, which had a generic Clydish outfit, and was told to "make him look like a wizard". Just a guess, but it seems likely, and it's not like much else in that picture was in the game either.)[url=http://www.dutchfurs.com/~haze/?cat=files&dir=files/pc/shareware]Free Jazz Jackrabbit games[/url]
[url=http://www.jazz2online.com/J2Ov2/]Downloads for Jazz Jackrabbit[/url]
[url=http://www.jazz2online.com/jcf/]Discussion of Jazz Jackrabbit[/url]
